attributes.action: bear in mind the long-standing commitment to the people of Aldershot and the surrounding area and encourage the Hampshire Primary Care Trust to provide funding so that the Aldershot Centre for Health will include from the outset a Minor Injuries Unit with the necessary staffing, management, equipment and protocols in place to offer treatment for a wide variety of problems.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Minor Injuries Unit at Aldershot Centre for Health could deal with: cuts/grazes and lacerations; sprains and strains; broken bones; bites and stings; infected wounds; head injuries; and, eye infections, foreign bodies & scratches.

For patients and financial sustainability, the best combination of A&E services in our part of Hampshire and Surrey would be:
Level 1 - MIU at Aldershot Centre for Health;
Level 2 - Urgent Care Centre (UCC) at Royal Surrey County Hospital; and,
Level 3 - Major A&E department at Frimley Park Hospital
 
The running costs of treating a minor injury at the MIU (Open Monday to Friday 7.00am to 10.00pm, Weekends and Bank Holidays 9.00am to 7.00pm.) would be less than those at the UCC (Open 18/7), which would be less than those at the Major A&E department (Open 24/7).
 
It makes no sense at all to have the flagship Aldershot Centre for Health – the largest such health centre in the whole country  – opening next year without the MIU up and running in the space allocated.

government_responses.details:
You recently signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "bear in mind the long-standing commitment to the people of Aldershot and the surrounding area and encourage the Hampshire Primary Care Trust to provide funding so that the Aldershot Centre for Health will include from the outset a Minor Injuries Unit with the necessary staffing, management, equipment and protocols in place to offer treatment for a wide variety of problems."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here:
